generalInfo: Ciclosporin is excreted in breast milk. Breastfeeding is generally not recommended during treatment.

hepaticImpairment.specificInfo: Dose adjustment and close monitoring of ciclosporin levels are recommended in moderate to severe hepatic impairment.

generalInfo: Use only if the potential benefit justifies the potential risk to the fetus. Ciclosporin crosses the placenta and may cause fetal harm.

renalImpairment.specificInfo: Avoid overdose, adjust dose and monitor serum ciclosporin concentrations regularly.

sideEffects.specificInfo: Common: Tremor; headache; hypertension; hirsutism; gingival hyperplasia; hyperlipidaemia; nausea; vomiting; diarrhoea; abdominal pain; renal dysfunction; Paraesthesia; muscle cramps; anorexia; hyperglycaemia; acne; fatigue. Uncommon: confusion; weight gain; posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome (PRES). Rare: pancreatitis; motor neuropathy; myopathy; menstrual disturbances. Frequency Not Known: hearing loss; hepatitis.

dosages.doseInfo: up to 2.5 mg/kg 2 times daily; adjust dose based on clinical response and blood levels
